com.iritech.mqel704

Class IrisQuality

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iritech.mqel704.IrisQuality

  • public class IrisQuality
extends java.lang.Object
    Consists of interested quality metrics of the captured image. Capturing process is designed in a way that is easy to acquire the best image in a stream based on predefined quality thresholds. However, it is strongly recommended that developers should have their own experiences and decisions on appropriate quality thresholds for enrollment and matching to enhance their system accuracy. The two important quality metrics are total score and usable area. Total score is a scalar value representing overall quality of the image and is computed using several NIST-defined (IQCE) and IriTechâ€™s proprietary metrics.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IrisQuality

        public IrisQuality()
        Construct an empty IrisQuality object.

      • IrisQuality

        public IrisQuality(int totalScore,
                   int usableArea)
        Construct an IrisQuality object with the given total score and usable area values.
        Parameters:
        totalScore - Total score of the captured image, ranging from 0 to 100. The higher the score, the better the image quality. Enrolled images should have a stringently high total score, e.g. greater than 70.
        usableArea - Percentage of usable iris area in the captured image, ranging from 0 to 100. The lower the score, the more occluded the iris. A highly occluded iris significantly affects the matching accuracy. Enrolled images should have a high value of usable iris area, e.g., greater than 70.

        public int getTotalScore()
        Get the total score of the captured image.
        Returns:
        Total score of an iris image, ranging from 0 to 100. The higher the score, the better the image quality. Enrolled images should have a stringently high total score, e.g. greater than 60.

      • getUsableArea

        public int getUsableArea()
        Get the usable area of the captured image.
        Returns:
        Percentage of usable iris area in the captured image, ranging from 0 to 100. The lower the score, the more occluded the iris. A highly occluded iris significantly affects the matching accuracy. Enrolled images should have a high value of usable iris area, e.g., greater than 70.

      • setIrisQuality

        public void setIrisQuality(int totalScore,
                           int usableArea)
        Set the quality for the captured iris.
        Parameters:
        totalScore - Total score of an iris image, ranging from 0 to 100. The higher the score, the better the image quality. Enrolled images should have a stringently high total score, e.g. greater than 60.
        usableArea - Percentage of usable iris area in the captured image, ranging from 0 to 100. The lower the score, the more occluded the iris. A highly occluded iris significantly affects the matching accuracy. Enrolled images should have a high value of usable iris area, e.g., greater than 70.
